intro: Ilex guianensis var. arimensis, commonly known as the Arimenis holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
